   20: -module(code_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   23: -include_lib("syntax_tools/include/merl.hrl").
   24: 
   25: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   26: -export([set_path/1, get_path/1, add_path/1, add_paths/1, del_path/1,
   27: 	 replace_path/1, load_file/1, load_abs/1,
   28:          ensure_loaded/1, ensure_loaded_many/1, ensure_loaded_many_kill/1,
   29:          ensure_loaded_bad_case/1,
   30: 	 delete/1, purge/1, purge_many_exits/0, purge_many_exits/1,
   31:          soft_purge/1, is_loaded/1, all_loaded/1, all_available/1,
   32: 	 load_binary/1, dir_req/1, object_code/1, set_path_file/1,
   33: 	 upgrade/0, upgrade/1,
   34: 	 sticky_dir/1, add_del_path/1,
   35:          pa_pz_option/1, remove_pa_pz_option/1,
   36: 	 dir_disappeared/1, ext_mod_dep/1, clash/1,
   37: 	 where_is_file/1,
   38: 	 purge_stacktrace/1, mult_lib_roots/1, bad_erl_libs/1,
   39: 	 code_archive/1, code_archive2/1, on_load/1,
   40:      on_load_binary/1, on_load_binary_twice/1,
   41: 	 on_load_embedded/1, on_load_errors/1, on_load_update/1,
   42:          on_load_trace_on_load/1,
   43: 	 on_load_purge/1, on_load_self_call/1, on_load_pending/1,
   44: 	 on_load_deleted/1, on_load_deadlock/1,
   45:          on_load_deadlock_load_binary_GH7466/1, on_load_deadlock_ensure_loaded_GH7466/1,
   46: 	 big_boot_embedded/1,
   47:          module_status/1,
   48: 	 get_mode/1, code_path_cache/1,
   49: 	 normalized_paths/1, mult_embedded_flags/1]).
   50: 
   51: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   52: 	 init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   53: 
   54: %% error_logger
   55: -export([init/1,
   56: 	 handle_event/2, handle_call/2, handle_info/2,
   57: 	 terminate/2]).
   58: 
   59: -export([compile_load/4]).
   60: 
   61: suite() ->
   62:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   63:      {timetrap,{seconds,30}}].
   64: 
   65: all() ->
   66:     [set_path, get_path, add_path, add_paths, del_path,
   67:      replace_path, load_file, load_abs,
   68:      ensure_loaded, ensure_loaded_many, ensure_loaded_many_kill,
   69:      ensure_loaded_bad_case,
   70:      delete, purge, purge_many_exits, soft_purge, is_loaded, all_loaded,
   71:      all_available, load_binary, dir_req, object_code, set_path_file,
   72:      upgrade, code_path_cache,
   73:      pa_pz_option, remove_pa_pz_option,
   74:      sticky_dir, add_del_path, dir_disappeared,
   75:      ext_mod_dep, clash, where_is_file,
   76:      purge_stacktrace, mult_lib_roots,
   77:      bad_erl_libs, code_archive, code_archive2, on_load,
   78:      on_load_binary, on_load_binary_twice,
   79:      on_load_embedded, on_load_errors,
   80:      {group, sequence},
   81:      on_load_purge, on_load_self_call, on_load_pending,
   82:      on_load_deleted, on_load_deadlock, on_load_deadlock_load_binary_GH7466,
   83:      on_load_deadlock_ensure_loaded_GH7466,
   84:      module_status,
   85:      big_boot_embedded, get_mode, normalized_paths,
   86:      mult_embedded_flags].
   87: 
   88: %% These need to run in order
   89: groups() -> [{sequence, [sequence], [on_load_update,
   90:                                      on_load_trace_on_load]}].
   91: 
   92: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   93: 	Config.
   94: 
   95: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   96: 	Config.
   97: 
   98: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   99:     %% The compiler will no longer create a Beam file if
  100:     %% the module name does not match the filename, so
  101:     %% we must compile to a binary and write the Beam file
  102:     %% ourselves.
  103:     Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  104:     File = filename:join(Dir, "code_a_test"),
  105:     {ok,code_b_test,Code} = compile:file(File, [binary]),
  106:     ok = file:write_file(File++".beam", Code),
  107:     Config.
  108: 
  109: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  110:     Config.
  111: 
  112: -define(TESTMOD, test_dummy).
  113: -define(TESTMODSTR, "test_dummy").
  114: -define(TESTMODSRC, ?TESTMODSTR ".erl").
  115: -define(TESTMODOBJ, ?TESTMODSTR ".beam").
  116: 
  117: init_per_testcase(big_boot_embedded, Config) ->
  118:     case catch application:start(crypto) of
  119: 	ok ->
  120: 	    init_per_testcase(do_big_boot_embedded, Config);
  121: 	_Else ->
  122: 	    {skip, "Needs crypto!"}
  123:     end;
  124: init_per_testcase(on_load_embedded, Config0) ->
  125:     LibRoot = code:lib_dir(),
  126:     LinkName = filename:join(LibRoot, "on_load_app-1.0"),
  127:     Config = [{link_name,LinkName}|Config0],
  128:     init_per_testcase(Config);
  129: init_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  130:     init_per_testcase(Config).
  131: 
  132: init_per_testcase(Config) ->
  133:     P = code:get_path(),
  134:     [{code_path, P}|Config].
  135: 
  136: 
  137: end_per_testcase(module_status, Config) ->
  138:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
  139:     code:delete(?TESTMOD),
  140:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
  141:     file:delete(?TESTMODOBJ),
  142:     file:delete(?TESTMODSRC),
  143:     end_per_testcase(Config);
  144: end_per_testcase(TC, Config) when TC == mult_lib_roots;
  145: 				  TC == big_boot_embedded ->
  146:     {ok, HostName} = inet:gethostname(),
  147:     NodeName = list_to_atom(atom_to_list(TC)++"@"++HostName),
  148:     test_server:stop_node(NodeName),
  149:     end_per_testcase(Config);
  150: end_per_testcase(on_load_embedded, Config) ->
  151:     LinkName = proplists:get_value(link_name, Config),
  152:     _ = del_link(LinkName),
  153:     end_per_testcase(Config);
  154: end_per_testcase(upgrade, Config) ->
  155:     %% Make sure tracing is turned off even if the test times out.
  156:     erlang:trace_pattern({error_handler,undefined_function,3}, false, [global]),
  157:     erlang:trace(self(), false, [call]),
  158:     end_per_testcase(Config);
  159: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  160:     end_per_testcase(Config).
  161: 
  162: end_per_testcase(Config) ->
  163:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  164:     P=proplists:get_value(code_path, Config),
  165:     true=code:set_path(P),
  166:     P=code:get_path(),
  167:     ok.
  168: 
  169: set_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  170:     P = code:get_path(),
  171:     NonExDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), test_server:temp_name("hej")),
  172:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:set_path({a})),
  173:     {error, bad_directory} = (catch code:set_path([{a}])),
  174:     {error, bad_directory} = code:set_path(NonExDir),
  175:     P = code:get_path(), % still the same path.
  176:     true = code:set_path(P), % set the same path again.
  177:     P = code:get_path(), % still the same path.
  178:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  179:     true = code:set_path([LibDir | P]),
  180:     [LibDir | P] = code:get_path(),
  181:     true = code:set_path([LibDir]),
  182:     [LibDir] = code:get_path(),
  183:     ok.
  184: 
  185: get_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  186:     P = code:get_path(),
  187:     %% test that all directories are strings (lists).
  188:     [] = lists:filter(fun
  189: 	    (Dir) when is_list(Dir) -> false;
  190: 	    (_) -> true
  191: 	end, P),
  192:     ok.
  193: 
  194: add_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  195:     P = code:get_path(),
  196:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:add_path({})),
  197:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:add_patha({})),
  198:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:add_pathz({})),
  199:     {error, bad_directory} = code:add_path("xyz"),
  200:     {error, bad_directory} = code:add_patha("xyz"),
  201:     {error, bad_directory} = code:add_pathz("xyz"),
  202:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  203:     true = code:add_path(LibDir),
  204:     LibDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  205:     code:set_path(P),
  206:     true = code:add_pathz(LibDir),
  207:     LibDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  208:     code:set_path(P),
  209:     true = code:add_patha(LibDir),
  210:     [LibDir|_] = code:get_path(),
  211:     code:set_path(P),
  212:     ok.
  213: 
  214: add_paths(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  215:     P = code:get_path(),
  216:     ok = code:add_paths([{}]),
  217:     ok = code:add_pathsa([{}]),
  218:     ok = code:add_pathsz([{}]),
  219:     ok = code:add_paths(["xyz"]),
  220:     ok = code:add_pathsa(["xyz"]),
  221:     ok = code:add_pathsz(["xyz"]),
  222:     P = code:get_path(), % check that no directory is added.
  223: 
  224:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  225:     ok = code:add_paths([LibDir]),
  226:     LibDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  227:     code:set_path(P),
  228:     ok = code:add_pathsz([LibDir]),
  229:     LibDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  230:     code:set_path(P),
  231:     ok = code:add_pathsa([LibDir]),
  232:     [LibDir|P] = code:get_path(),
  233:     code:set_path(P),
  234: 
  235:     RootDir = code:root_dir(),
  236:     Res = P ++ [LibDir, RootDir],
  237:     ok = code:add_paths([LibDir, RootDir]),
  238:     Res = code:get_path(),
  239:     code:set_path(P),
  240:     ok = code:add_pathsz([LibDir, RootDir]),
  241:     Res = code:get_path(),
  242:     code:set_path(P),
  243:     ok = code:add_pathsa([LibDir, RootDir]),
  244:     [RootDir, LibDir|P] = code:get_path(),
  245:     code:set_path(P),
  246: 
  247:     ok = code:add_paths([LibDir, "xyz"]),
  248:     Res1 = P ++ [LibDir],
  249:     Res1 = code:get_path(),
  250:     code:set_path(P),
  251:     ok = code:add_pathsz([LibDir, "xyz"]),
  252:     Res1 = code:get_path(),
  253:     code:set_path(P),
  254:     ok = code:add_pathsa([LibDir, "xyz"]),
  255:     [LibDir|P] = code:get_path(),
  256:     code:set_path(P),
  257:     ok.
  258: 
  259: del_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  260:     P = code:get_path(),
  261:     try
  262: 	del_path_1(P)
  263:     after
  264: 	code:set_path(P)
  265:     end.
  266: 
  267: del_path_1(P) ->
  268:     io:format("Initial code:get_path()=~p~n",[P]),
  269:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:del_path(3)),
  270:     false = code:del_path(my_dummy_name),
  271:     false = code:del_path("/kdlk/my_dummy_dir"),
  272:     Dir = filename:join([code:lib_dir(kernel),"ebin"]),
  273:     io:format("kernel dir: ~p~n",[Dir]),
  274: 
  275:     true = code:del_path(kernel),
  276:     NewP = code:get_path(),
  277:     io:format("Path after removing 'kernel':~p~n",[NewP]),
  278:     ReferenceP = lists:delete(Dir,P),
  279:     io:format("Reference path:~p~n",[ReferenceP]),
  280:     NewP = ReferenceP, % check that dir is deleted
  281:     code:set_path(P),
  282: 
  283:     %% An superfluous "/" should also work.
  284:     true = code:del_path("kernel/"),
  285:     NewP = ReferenceP,			   % check that dir is deleted
  286:     code:set_path(P),
  287: 
  288:     true = code:del_path(Dir),
  289:     NewP1 = code:get_path(),
  290:     NewP1 = lists:delete(Dir,P), % check that dir is deleted
  291:     ok.
  292: 
  293: replace_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  294:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  295:     P = code:get_path(),
  296:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:replace_path(3,"")),
  297:     {error, bad_name} = code:replace_path(dummy_name,""),
  298:     {error, bad_name} = code:replace_path(kernel,
  299: 						"/kdlk/my_dummy_dir"),
  300:     {error, bad_directory} = code:replace_path(kernel,
  301: 						     "/kdlk/kernel-1.2"),
  302:     P = code:get_path(), % Check that path is not changed.
  303: 
  304:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  305: 
  306:     %% Replace an existing application.
  307: 
  308:     file:make_dir("./kernel-2.11"),
  309:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  310:     NewDir = Cwd ++ "/kernel-2.11",
  311:     true = code:replace_path(kernel, NewDir),
  312:     NewDir = code:lib_dir(kernel),
  313:     true = code:set_path(P),			%Reset path
  314:     ok = file:del_dir("./kernel-2.11"),
  315: 
  316:     %% Add a completely new application.
  317: 
  318:     NewAppName = 'blurf_blarfer',
  319:     NewAppDir = filename:join(Cwd, atom_to_list(NewAppName) ++ "-6.33.1"),
  320:     ok = file:make_dir(NewAppDir),
  321:     true = code:replace_path(NewAppName, NewAppDir),
  322:     NewAppDir = code:lib_dir(NewAppName),
  323:     NewAppDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  324:     true = code:set_path(P),			%Reset path
  325:     ok = file:del_dir(NewAppDir),
  326: 
  327:     ok.
  328: 
  329: code_path_cache(Config) ->
  330:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  331: 
  332:     non_existing = code:which(?TESTMOD), % verify dummy name not in path
  333:     code:purge(?TESTMOD), % ensure no previous version in memory
  334:     code:delete(?TESTMOD),
  335:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
  336: 
  337:     Original = code:get_path(),
  338:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "myebin"),
  339:     filelib:ensure_path(Dir),
  340:     ToBeReplacedDir1 = filename:join(PrivDir, "tobereplaced-1/ebin"),
  341:     ToBeReplacedDir2 = filename:join(PrivDir, "tobereplaced-2/ebin"),
  342:     filelib:ensure_path(ToBeReplacedDir1),
  343:     filelib:ensure_path(ToBeReplacedDir2),
  344: 
  345:     File = filename:join(Dir, ?TESTMODOBJ),
  346:     {ok,?TESTMOD,Bin} = compile:forms(dummy_ast(), []),
  347: 
  348:     %% Adding a cached path and re-adding for clearing
  349:     [begin
  350:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  351:         true = code:Fun(Dir, cache),
  352:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  353:         ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
  354:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  355:         true = code:Fun(Dir, cache),
  356:         {_,_,_} = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  357:         code:del_path(Dir),
  358:         ok = file:delete(File)
  359:      end || Fun <- [add_path, add_patha, add_pathz]],
  360: 
  361:     Original = code:get_path(),
  362: 
  363:     %% Adding several cached paths and explicit cache clearing
  364:     [begin
  365:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  366:         ok = code:Fun([Dir, ToBeReplacedDir1], cache),
  367:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  368:         ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
  369:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  370:         ok = code:clear_cache(),
  371:         {_,_,_} = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  372:         ok = code:del_paths([Dir, ToBeReplacedDir1]),
  373:         ok = file:delete(File)
  374:      end || Fun <- [add_paths, add_pathsa, add_pathsz]],
  375: 
  376:     Original = code:get_path(),
  377: 
  378:     %% Replacing a non-cached path with cache and set_path for clearing
  379:     error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  380:     true = code:add_path(ToBeReplacedDir1),
  381:     true = code:replace_path(tobereplaced, ToBeReplacedDir2, cache),
  382:     error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  383:     ok = file:write_file(filename:join(ToBeReplacedDir2, ?TESTMODOBJ), Bin),
  384:     error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  385:     true = code:set_path(code:get_path(), nocache),
  386:     {_,_,_} = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  387: 
  388:     true = code:set_path(Original),
  389:     ok.
  390: 
  391: %% OTP-3977.
  392: dir_disappeared(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  393:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  394:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "temp"),
  395:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  396:     true = code:add_path(Dir),
  397:     ok = file:del_dir(Dir),
  398:     non_existing = code:which(bubbelskrammel),
  399:     ok.
  400: 
  401: load_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  402:     {error, nofile} = code:load_file(duuuumy_mod),
  403:     {error, badfile} = code:load_file(code_a_test),
  404:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch code:load_file(123)),
  405:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_file(code_b_test),
  406:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  407:     code:stick_dir(TestDir),
  408:     {error, sticky_directory} = code:load_file(code_b_test),
  409:     code:unstick_dir(TestDir),
  410:     ok.
  411: 
  412: test_dir() ->
  413:     filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)).
  414: 
  415: load_abs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  416:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  417:     {error, nofile} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/duuuumy_mod"),
  418:     {error, badfile} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_a_test"),
  419:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch code:load_abs({})),
  420:     {error, nofile} = code:load_abs("Non-latin-имя-файла"),
  421:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test"),
  422:     code:stick_dir(TestDir),
  423:     {error, sticky_directory} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test"),
  424:     code:unstick_dir(TestDir),
  425:     ok.
  426: 
  427: ensure_loaded_bad_case(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  428:     %% Make sure loading an invalid .beam file does
  429:     %% not hold a permanent lock on the server.
  430:     {error, _} = code:ensure_loaded('STRING'),
  431:     {error, _} = code:ensure_loaded('STRING'),
  432:     ok.
  433: 
  434: ensure_loaded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  435:     {module, lists} = code:ensure_loaded(lists),
  436:     case init:get_argument(mode) of
  437: 	{ok, [["embedded"] | _]} ->
  438: 	    {error, embedded} = code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test),
  439: 	    {error, badarg} = code:ensure_loaded(34),
  440: 	    ok;
  441: 	_ ->
  442: 	    {error, nofile} = code:ensure_loaded(duuuumy_mod),
  443: 	    {error, badfile} = code:ensure_loaded(code_a_test),
  444: 	    {'EXIT', _} = (catch code:ensure_loaded(34)),
  445: 	    {module, code_b_test} = code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test),
  446: 	    {module, code_b_test} = code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test),
  447: 	    ok
  448:     end.
  449: 
  450: ensure_loaded_many(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  451:     with_large_loadpath_peer(Config, fun(Node) ->
  452:         %% Without special handling for async loading in code server,
  453:         %% this operation seemed to consistently take 5s+
  454:         Action = fun() ->
  455:             Self = self(),
  456:             Fun = fun() -> code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test), Self ! {done, self()} end,
  457:             Pids = [spawn(Fun) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 1_000)],
  458:             [receive {done, Pid} -> ok end || Pid <- Pids],
  459:             ok
  460:         end,
  461:         ok = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [Action, []], 1_000)
  462:     end).
  463: 
  464: ensure_loaded_many_kill(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  465:     with_large_loadpath_peer(Config, fun(Node) ->
  466:         Action = fun() ->
  467:             Self = self(),
  468:             Fun = fun() -> code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test), Self ! {done, self()} end,
  469:             sys:suspend(code_server),
  470:             First = spawn_opt(Fun, [{priority, max}]),
  471:             Pids = [spawn(Fun) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 1_000)],
  472:             sys:resume(code_server),
  473:             exit(First, kill),
  474:             [receive {done, Pid} -> ok end || Pid <- Pids],
  475:             {file, _} = code:is_loaded(code_b_test),
  476:             ok
  477:         end,
  478:         ok = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [Action, []])
  479:     end).
  480: 
  481: with_large_loadpath_peer(Config, Fun) ->
  482:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  483:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  484:     ok = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [fun set_up_large_loadpath/1, [Priv]]),
  485:     try Fun(Node)
  486:     after peer:stop(Peer)
  487:     end.
  488: 
  489: set_up_large_loadpath(Priv) ->
  490:     false = code:delete(code_b_test),
  491:     Dirs = [filename:join(Priv, integer_to_list(N)) || N <- lists:seq(1, 500)],
  492:     [ok = filelib:ensure_path(Dir) || Dir <- Dirs],
  493:     [true = code:add_patha(Dir) || Dir <- Dirs],
  494:     ok.
  495: 
  496: delete(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  497:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  498:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  499:     Pid = code_b_test:do_spawn(),
  500:     true = code:delete(code_b_test),
  501:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:delete(122)),
  502:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  503:     false = code:delete(code_b_test),
  504:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  505:     exit(Pid,kill),
  506:     true = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  507:     false = code:delete(code_b_test),
  508:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  509:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  510:     ok.
  511: 
  512: purge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  513:     run_purge_test(fun purge_test/1, Config).
  514: 
  515: purge_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  516:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  517:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  518:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:purge({})),
  519:     false = code:purge(code_b_test),
  520:     Pid = code_b_test:do_spawn(),
  521:     true = code:delete(code_b_test),
  522:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  523:     true = code:purge(code_b_test),
  524:     true = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  525:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  526:     ok.
  527: 
  528: purge_many_exits() ->
  529:     [{timetrap, {minutes, 2}}].
  530: 
  531: purge_many_exits(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  532:     run_purge_test(fun purge_many_exits_test/1, Config).
  533: 
  534: purge_many_exits_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  535:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  536: 
  537:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  538:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:purge({})),
  539: 
  540:     CodePurgeF = fun(M, Exp) -> Exp = code:purge(M) end,
  541:     purge_many_exits_do(CodePurgeF),
  542: 
  543:     %% Let's repeat test for erlang:purge_module as it does the same thing
  544:     %% now in erts-8.0 (except for return value).
  545:     ErlangPurgeF = fun(M, _Exp) -> erlang:purge_module(M) end,
  546:     purge_many_exits_do(ErlangPurgeF),
  547: 
  548:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  549:     ok.
  550: 
  551: 
  552: purge_many_exits_do(PurgeF) ->
  553:     false = code:purge(code_b_test),
  554:     TPids = lists:map(fun (_) ->
  555: 			      {code_b_test:do_spawn(),
  556: 			       spawn_link(fun () ->
  557: 						  receive
  558: 						  after infinity -> ok
  559: 						  end
  560: 					  end)}
  561: 			 end,
  562: 			 lists:seq(1, 1000)),
  563:     %% Give them time to start...
  564:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  565:     true = code:delete(code_b_test),
  566:     lists:foreach(fun ({Pid1, Pid2}) ->
  567: 			  true = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid1),
  568: 			  false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid1),
  569: 			  true = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid2)
  570: 		  end, TPids),
  571:     PurgeF(code_b_test, true),
  572:     lists:foreach(fun ({Pid1, Pid2}) ->
  573: 			  false = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid1),
  574: 			  true = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid1),
  575: 			  true = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid2),
  576: 			  exit(Pid2, kill)
  577: 		  end, TPids),
  578:     lists:foreach(fun ({_Pid1, Pid2}) ->
  579: 			  receive {'EXIT', Pid2, _} -> ok end
  580: 		  end, TPids).
  581: 
  582: 
  583: soft_purge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  584:     run_purge_test(fun soft_purge_test/1, Config).
  585: 
  586: soft_purge_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  587:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  588:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  589:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:soft_purge(23)),
  590:     true = code:soft_purge(code_b_test),
  591:     Pid = code_b_test:do_spawn(),
  592:     true = code:delete(code_b_test),
  593:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  594:     false = code:soft_purge(code_b_test),
  595:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  596:     exit(Pid,kill),
  597:     true = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  598:     true = code:soft_purge(code_b_test),
  599:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  600:     ok.
  601: 
  602: is_loaded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  603:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  604:     code:delete(code_b_test),
  605:     false = code:is_loaded(duuuuuumy_mod),
  606:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:is_loaded(23)),
  607:     {file, preloaded} = code:is_loaded(init),
  608:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  609:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test"),
  610:     {file, _Loaded} = code:is_loaded(code_b_test),
  611:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  612:     code:delete(code_b_test),
  613:     ok.
  614: 
  615: all_loaded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  616:     case test_server:is_cover() of
  617: 	true -> {skip,"Cover is running"};
  618: 	false -> all_loaded_1()
  619:     end.
  620: 
  621: all_loaded_1() ->
  622:     Preloaded = [{M,preloaded} || M <- lists:sort(erlang:pre_loaded())],
  623: 
  624:     Loaded0 = lists:sort(code:all_loaded()),
  625:     all_unique(Loaded0),
  626:     Loaded1 = lists:keysort(2, Loaded0),
  627:     Loaded2 = match_and_remove(Preloaded, Loaded1),
  628: 
  629:     ObjExt = code:objfile_extension(),
  630:     [] = lists:filter(fun
  631: 	    ({Mod,AbsName}) when is_atom(Mod), is_list(AbsName) ->
  632: 		Mod =/= list_to_atom(filename:basename(AbsName, ObjExt));
  633: 	    (_) -> true
  634: 	end, Loaded2),
  635:     ok.
  636: 
  637: match_and_remove([], List) -> List;
  638: match_and_remove([X|T1], [X|T2]) -> match_and_remove(T1, T2).
  639: 
  640: all_unique([]) -> ok;
  641: all_unique([_]) -> ok;
  642: all_unique([{X,_}|[{Y,_}|_]=T]) when X < Y -> all_unique(T).
  643: 
  644: all_available(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  645:     case test_server:is_cover() of
  646: 	true -> {skip,"Cover is running"};
  647: 	false -> all_available_1(Config)
  648:     end.
  649: 
  650: all_available_1(Config) ->
  651: 
  652:     %% Add an ez dir to make sure the modules in there are found
  653:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config)++"clash/",
  654:     true = code:add_path(DDir++"foobar-0.1.ez/foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  655: 
  656:     Available = code:all_available(),
  657: 
  658:     %% Test that baz and blarg that are part of the .ez archive are found
  659:     {value, _} =
  660:         lists:search(fun({Name,_,Loaded}) -> not Loaded andalso Name =:= "baz" end, Available),
  661:     {value, _} =
  662:         lists:search(fun({Name,_,Loaded}) -> not Loaded andalso Name =:= "blarg" end, Available),
  663: 
  664:     %% Test that all loaded are part of all available
  665:     Loaded = [{atom_to_list(M),P,true} || {M,P} <- code:all_loaded()],
  666:     [] = Loaded -- Available,
  667: 
  668:     {value, {ModStr,_,false} = NotLoaded} =
  669:         lists:search(fun({Name,_,Loaded}) -> not is_atom(Name) end, Available),
  670:     ct:log("Testing with ~p",[NotLoaded]),
  671: 
  672:     Mod = list_to_atom(ModStr),
  673: 
  674:     %% Test that the module is actually not loaded
  675:     false = code:is_loaded(Mod),
  676: 
  677:     %% Load it
  678:     Mod:module_info(),
  679: 
  680:     {value, {ModStr,_,true}} =
  681:         lists:search(fun({Name,_,_}) -> Name =:= ModStr end, code:all_available()),
  682: 
  683:     ok.
  684: 
  685: load_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  686:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  687:     File = TestDir ++ "/code_b_test" ++ code:objfile_extension(),
  688:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(File),
  689:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:load_binary(12, File, Bin)),
  690:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:load_binary(code_b_test, 12, Bin)),
  691:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:load_binary(code_b_test, File, 12)),
  692:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_binary(code_b_test, File, Bin),
  693:     code:stick_dir(TestDir),
  694:     {error, sticky_directory} = code:load_binary(code_b_test, File, Bin),
  695:     code:unstick_dir(TestDir),
  696:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  697:     code:delete(code_b_test),
  698:     ok.
  699: 
  700: 
  701: upgrade() ->
  702:     [{timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
  703: 
  704: upgrade(Config) ->
  705:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  706:     upgrade_do(DataDir, beam, [beam]),
  707:     ok.
  708: 
  709: upgrade_do(DataDir, Client, T) ->
  710:     compile_load(upgrade_client, DataDir, undefined, Client),
  711:     [upgrade_client:run(DataDir, U1, U2, O1, O2)
  712:      || U1<-T, U2<-T, O1<-T, O2<-T],
  713:     ok.
  714: 
  715: compile_load(Mod, Dir, Ver, CodeType) ->
  716:     %%erlang:display({"{{{{{{{{{{{{{{{{Loading",Mod,Ver,CodeType}),
  717:     Version = case Ver of
  718: 	undefined ->
  719: 	    io:format("Compiling '~p' as ~p\n", [Mod, CodeType]),
  720: 	    [];
  721: 	_ ->
  722: 	    io:format("Compiling version ~p of '~p' as ~p\n",
  723: 		[Ver, Mod, CodeType]),
  724: 	    [{d,list_to_atom("VERSION_" ++ integer_to_list(Ver))}]
  725:     end,
  726: 
  727:     CompOpts = [binary, report] ++ Version,
  728: 
  729:     Src = filename:join(Dir, atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl"),
  730:     T1 = erlang:now(),
  731:     {ok,Mod,Code} = compile:file(Src, CompOpts),
  732:     T2 = erlang:now(),
  733:     ObjFile = filename:basename(Src,".erl") ++ ".beam",
  734:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, ObjFile, Code),
  735:     T3 = erlang:now(),
  736:     io:format("Compile time ~p ms, Load time ~p ms\n",
  737: 	      [timer:now_diff(T2,T1) div 1000, timer:now_diff(T3,T2) div 1000]),
  738:     %%erlang:display({"}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}Loaded",Mod,Ver,CodeType}),
  739:     ok.
  740: 
  741: dir_req(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  742:     {ok,[[Root0]]} = init:get_argument(root),
  743:     Root = filename:join([Root0]),	% Normalised form.
  744:     Root = code:root_dir(),
  745:     LibDir = Root ++ "/lib",
  746:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  747:     code:compiler_dir(),
  748:     {error, bad_name} = code:lib_dir(duuumy),
  749:     KernLib = code:lib_dir(kernel),
  750:     Priv = KernLib ++ "/priv",
  751:     Priv = code:priv_dir(kernel),
  752:     {error, bad_name} = code:priv_dir(duuumy),
  753:     ok.
  754: 
  755: object_code(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  756:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  757:     P = code:get_path(),
  758:     P = code:get_path(),
  759:     code:add_path(TestDir),
  760:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test"),
  761:     LoadedFile = filename:absname(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test" ++
  762: 				  code:objfile_extension()),
  763:     case code:get_object_code(code_b_test) of
  764: 	      {code_b_test,Bin,LoadedFile} when is_binary(Bin) ->
  765: 		  ok
  766: 	  end,
  767:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  768:     code:delete(code_b_test),
  769:     error = code:get_object_code(dddddddduuuuuuumy),
  770:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:get_object_code(23)),
  771:     code:set_path(P),
  772:     P=code:get_path(),
  773:     ok.
  774: 
  775: %% Test that set_path does not accept
  776: %% files as pathnames (known previous bug)
  777: set_path_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  778:     File=filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "testfil"),
  779:     ok=file:write_file(File, list_to_binary("lite data")),
  780:     {error, bad_directory}=code:set_path([File]).
  781: 
  782: %% Test that a module with the same name as a module in
  783: %% a sticky directory cannot be loaded.
  784: sticky_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  785:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  786:     Mods = [code,lists,erlang,init],
  787:     OutDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), sticky_dir),
  788:     _ = file:make_dir(OutDir),
  789:     Ret = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply,
  790: 		   [fun sticky_compiler/2,[Mods,OutDir]]),
  791:     case Ret of
  792: 	[] ->
  793: 	    ok;
  794: 	Other ->
  795: 	    io:format("~p\n", [Other]),
  796: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  797:     end,
  798:     peer:stop(Peer),
  799:     ok.
  800: 
  801: sticky_compiler(Files, PrivDir) ->
  802:     code:add_patha(PrivDir),
  803:     Rets = [do_sticky_compile(F, PrivDir) || F <- Files],
  804:     [R || R <- Rets, R =/= ok].
  805: 
  806: do_sticky_compile(Mod, Dir) ->
  807:     case code:is_sticky(Mod) of
  808:         true ->
  809:             %% Make sure that the module is loaded. A module being sticky
  810:             %% only prevents it from begin reloaded, not from being loaded
  811:             %% from the wrong place to begin with.
  812:             Mod = Mod:module_info(module),
  813:             File = filename:append(Dir, atom_to_list(Mod)),
  814:             Src = io_lib:format("-module(~s).\n"
  815:                                 "-export([test/1]).\n"
  816:                                 "test(me) -> fail.\n", [Mod]),
  817:             ok = file:write_file(File++".erl", Src),
  818:             case c:c(File, [{outdir,Dir}]) of
  819:                 {ok,Module} ->
  820:                     Module:test(me);
  821:                 {error,sticky_directory} ->
  822:                     ok
  823:             end;
  824:         false ->
  825:             %% For some reason the module is not sticky
  826:             %% could be that the .erlang file has
  827:             %% unstuck it?
  828:             {Mod, is_not_sticky}
  829:     end.
  830: 
  831: %% Test that the -pa and -pz options work as expected.
  832: pa_pz_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  833:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
  834:     PaDir = filename:join(DDir,"pa"),
  835:     PzDir = filename:join(DDir,"pz"),
  836:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-pa", PaDir, "-pz", PzDir]),
  837:     Ret=rpc:call(Node, code, get_path, []),
  838:     [PaDir|Paths] = Ret,
  839:     [PzDir|_] = lists:reverse(Paths),
  840:     peer:stop(Peer),
  841:     {ok, Peer2, Node2} = ?CT_PEER(["-mode", "embedded", "-pa",
  842:         PaDir, "-pz", PzDir]),
  843:     Ret2=rpc:call(Node2, code, get_path, []),
  844:     [PaDir|Paths2] = Ret2,
  845:     [PzDir|_] = lists:reverse(Paths2),
  846:     peer:stop(Peer2).
  847: 
  848: %% Test that we can remove paths added via -pa and -pz.
  849: remove_pa_pz_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  850:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
  851:     PaDir = filename:join(DDir,"clash/foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  852:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-pa", PaDir]),
  853:     {_,_,_} = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [blarg]),
  854:     true = rpc:call(Node, code, del_path, [PaDir]),
  855:     error = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [blarg]),
  856:     peer:stop(Peer).
  857: 
  858: %% add_path, del_path should not cause priv_dir(App) to fail.
  859: add_del_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  860:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
  861:     Dir1 = filename:join(DDir,"dummy_app-1.0/ebin"),
  862:     Dir2 = filename:join(DDir,"dummy_app-2.0/ebin"),
  863:     code:add_patha(Dir1),
  864:     PrivDir1 = filename:join(DDir,"dummy_app-1.0/priv"),
  865:     PrivDir1 = code:priv_dir(dummy_app),
  866:     code:add_path(Dir2), % put last in path
  867:     PrivDir1 = code:priv_dir(dummy_app),
  868:     code:del_path(Dir2),
  869:     PrivDir1 = code:priv_dir(dummy_app),
  870:     ok.
  871: 
  872: 
  873: clash(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  874:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config)++"clash/",
  875:     P = code:get_path(),
  876: 
  877:     %% test non-clashing entries
  878: 
  879:     true = code:add_path(DDir++"foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  880:     true = code:add_path(DDir++"zork-0.8/ebin"),
  881:     ct:capture_start(),
  882:     ok = code:clash(),
  883:     ct:capture_stop(),
  884:     [OKMsg|_] = ct:capture_get(),
  885:     true = lists:prefix("** Found 0 name clashes", OKMsg),
  886:     true = code:set_path(P),
  887: 
  888:     %% test clashing entries
  889: 
  890:     true = code:add_path(DDir++"foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  891:     true = code:add_path(DDir++"foobar-0.1.ez/foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  892:     ct:capture_start(),
  893:     ok = code:clash(),
  894:     ct:capture_stop(),
  895:     [ClashMsg|_] = ct:capture_get(),
  896:     {match, [" hides "]} = re:run(ClashMsg, "\\*\\* .*( hides ).*",
  897: 					[{capture,all_but_first,list}]),
  898:     true = code:set_path(P),
  899: 
  900:     %% test "Bad path can't read"
  901: 
  902:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  903:     TmpEzFile = Priv++"foobar-0.tmp.ez",
  904:     {ok, _} = file:copy(DDir++"foobar-0.1.ez", TmpEzFile),
  905:     true = code:add_path(TmpEzFile++"/foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  906:     case os:type() of
  907:         {win32,_} ->
  908: 	    %% The file won't be deleted on windows until it's closed, why we
  909: 	    %% need to rename instead.
  910: 	    ok = file:rename(TmpEzFile,TmpEzFile++".moved");
  911: 	 _ ->
  912:     	    ok = file:delete(TmpEzFile)
  913:     end,
  914:     ct:capture_start(),
  915:     ok = code:clash(),
  916:     ct:capture_stop(),
  917:     [BadPathMsg|_] = ct:capture_get(),
  918:     true = lists:prefix("** Bad path can't read", BadPathMsg),
  919:     true = code:set_path(P),
  920:     file:delete(TmpEzFile++".moved"), %% Only effect on windows
  921:     ok.
  922: 
  923: %% Every module that the code_server uses should be preloaded,
  924: %% this test case verifies that.
  925: ext_mod_dep(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  926:     xref:start(s),
  927:     xref:set_default(s, [{verbose,false},{warnings,false},
  928: 			 {builtins,true},{recurse,true}]),
  929:     xref:set_library_path(s, code:get_path()),
  930:     xref:add_directory(s, filename:join(code:lib_dir(kernel),"ebin")),
  931:     xref:add_directory(s, filename:join(code:lib_dir(stdlib),"ebin")),
  932:     case catch ext_mod_dep2() of
  933: 	{'EXIT', Reason} ->
  934: 	    xref:stop(s),
  935: 	    exit(Reason);
  936: 	Else ->
  937:     	    xref:stop(s),
  938: 	    case Else of
  939: 		ok -> ok;
  940: 		_ -> ct:fail(Else)
  941: 	    end
  942:     end.
  943: 
  944: ext_mod_dep2() ->
  945:     Exports0 = code_server:module_info(exports) --
  946: 	[{module_info,0},{module_info,1}],
  947:     Exports = [{code_server,M,A} || {M,A} <- Exports0],
  948:     case analyse(Exports, [], [], 0) of
  949: 	{_Visited,0} ->
  950: 	    ok;
  951: 	{_Visited,ErrCnt} ->
  952: 	    {not_verified,ErrCnt}
  953:     end.
  954: 
  955: analyse([], [], Visited, ErrCnt) ->
  956:     {Visited,ErrCnt};
  957: analyse([], [This={M,F,A}|Path], Visited, ErrCnt0) ->
  958:     %% The code_server has been granted to use the following modules,
  959:     %% These modules should be loaded by code.erl before
  960:     %% the code_server is started.
  961:     OK = [erlang, os, prim_file, erl_prim_loader, init, ets,
  962: 	  code_server, lists, lists_sort, unicode, binary, filename,
  963: 	  gb_sets, gb_trees, erts_code_purger, erts_internal, code,
  964: 	  prim_zip, zlib],
  965:     ErrCnt1 =
  966: 	case lists:member(M, OK) or erlang:is_builtin(M,F,A) of
  967: 	    true ->
  968: 		0;
  969: 	    false ->
  970: 		check_funs(This, Path)
  971: 	end,
  972:     {Visited, ErrCnt1+ErrCnt0};
  973: analyse([MFA|R], Path, Visited0, ErrCnt0) ->
  974:     case lists:member(MFA,Visited0) of
  975: 	false ->
  976: 	    {Visited,ErrCnt1} = analyse2(MFA, Path, Visited0),
  977: 	    analyse(R, Path, Visited, ErrCnt1+ErrCnt0);
  978: 	true ->
  979: 	    analyse(R, Path, Visited0, ErrCnt0)
  980:     end.
  981: 
  982: analyse2(MFA = {'$M_EXPR',_, _}, Path, Visited0) ->
  983:     analyse([], [MFA|Path], Visited0, 0);
  984: analyse2(MFA={_,_,_}, Path, Visited0) ->
  985:     {ok, FL} = xref:analyze(s,{call,MFA}),
  986:     analyse(FL, [MFA|Path], my_usort([MFA|Visited0]), 0).
  987: 
  988: %%%% We need to check these manually...
  989: %% fun's are ok as long as they are defined locally.
  990: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
  991: 	   [{unicode,characters_to_binary_int,3},
  992: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary,3},
  993: 	    {filename,filename_string_to_binary,1}|_]) -> 0;
  994: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
  995: 	   [{unicode,ml_map,3},
  996: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary_int,3},
  997: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary,3},
  998: 	    {filename,filename_string_to_binary,1}|_]) -> 0;
  999: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
 1000: 	   [{unicode,do_o_binary2,2},
 1001: 	    {unicode,do_o_binary,2},
 1002: 	    {unicode,o_trans,1},
 1003: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary_int,3},
 1004: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary,3},
 1005: 	    {filename,filename_string_to_binary,1}|_]) -> 0;
 1006: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
 1007: 	   [{code_server,do_mod_call,4},
 1008: 	    {code_server,handle_call,3}|_]) -> 0;
 1009: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
 1010: 	   [{lists,flatmap_1,2},
 1011: 	    {lists,flatmap,2},
 1012: 	    {lists,concat,1},
 1013: 	    {code_server,load_abs,4},
 1014: 	    {code_server,handle_call,3},
 1015: 	    {code_server,loop,1}|_]) -> 0;
 1016: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
 1017: 	   [{lists,foreach_1,2},
 1018: 	    {lists,foreach,2},
 1019: 	    {code_server,stick_dir,3},
 1020: 	    {code_server,handle_call,3},
 1021: 	    {code_server,loop,1}|_]) -> 0;
 1022: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',1},
 1023: 	   [{lists,all,2},
 1024: 	    {code_server,is_numstr,1},
 1025: 	    {code_server,is_vsn,1},
 1026: 	    {code_server,vsn_to_num,1},
 1027: 	    {code_server,create_bundle,2},
 1028: 	    {code_server,choose_bundles,1},
 1029: 	    {code_server,make_path,2},
 1030: 	    {code_server,get_user_lib_dirs_1,1},
 1031: 	    {code_server,get_user_lib_dirs,0},
 1032: 	    {code_server,init,3},
 1033: 	    {code_server,start_link,1}]) -> 0;
 1034: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',1},
 1035: 	   [{lists,all_1,2},
 1036: 	    {lists,all,2},
 1037: 	    {code_server,is_numstr,1},
 1038: 	    {code_server,is_vsn,1},
 1039: 	    {code_server,vsn_to_num,1},
 1040: 	    {code_server,create_bundle,2},
 1041: 	    {code_server,choose_bundles,1},
 1042: 	    {code_server,make_path,2},
 1043: 	    {code_server,get_user_lib_dirs_1,1},
 1044: 	    {code_server,get_user_lib_dirs,0},
 1045: 	    {code_server,init,3},
 1046: 	    {code_server,start_link,1}]) -> 0;
 1047: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',1},
 1048: 	   [{lists,filter,2},
 1049: 	    {code_server,try_archive_subdirs,3}|_]) -> 0;
 1050: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
 1051: 	   [{erlang,apply,2},
 1052: 	    {erlang,spawn_link,1},
 1053: 	    {code_server,start_link,1}]) -> 0;
 1054: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
 1055: 	   [{erlang,spawn_link,1},{code_server,start_link,1}]) -> 0;
 1056: check_funs({'$M_EXPR',warning_msg,2},
 1057: 	   [{code_server,finish_on_load_report,2} | _]) -> 0;
 1058: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',1},
 1059: 	   [{code_server,run,2}|_]) -> 0;
 1060: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',2},
 1061: 	   [{code_server,handle_on_load,5}|_]) -> 0;
 1062: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',2},
 1063: 	   [{code_server,handle_pending_on_load,4}|_]) -> 0;
 1064: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',2},
 1065: 	   [{code_server,finish_on_load_2,3}|_]) -> 0;
 1066: check_funs(This, Path) ->
 1067:     io:format("not_verified(~p, ~p)~n", [This, Path]),
 1068:     1.
 1069: 
 1070: my_usort(List) ->
 1071:     lists:reverse(uniq(lists:sort(List),[])).
 1072: 
 1073: uniq([],A) ->
 1074:     A;
 1075: uniq([H|T],[]) ->
 1076:     uniq(T,[H]);
 1077: uniq([H|T],[H|_]=A) ->
 1078:     uniq(T,A);
 1079: uniq([H|T],A) ->
 1080:     uniq(T,[H|A]).
 1081: 
 1082: 
 1083: where_is_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1084:     {T,KernelBeamFile} = timer:tc(code, where_is_file, ["kernel.beam"]),
 1085:     io:format("Load time: ~w ms~n", [T]),
 1086:     KernelEbinDir = filename:dirname(KernelBeamFile),
 1087:     AppFile = filename:join(KernelEbinDir, "kernel.app"),
 1088:     AppFile = code:where_is_file("kernel.app"),
 1089:     non_existing = code:where_is_file("kernel"), % no such file
 1090:     ok.
 1091: 
 1092: %% Test that stacktrace is deleted when purging a referred module.
 1093: purge_stacktrace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1094:     run_purge_test(fun purge_stacktrace_test/1, Config).
 1095:     
 1096: purge_stacktrace_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1097:     code:purge(code_b_test),
 1098:     try code_b_test:call(fun(b) -> ok end, a)
 1099:     catch
 1100: 	error:function_clause:Stacktrace ->
 1101: 	    code:load_file(code_b_test),
 1102: 	    case Stacktrace of
 1103: 		      [{?MODULE,_,[a],_},
 1104: 		       {code_b_test,call,2,_},
 1105: 		       {?MODULE,purge_stacktrace_test,1,_}|_] ->
 1106: 			  false = code:purge(code_b_test)
 1107: 		  end
 1108:     end,
 1109:     try code_b_test:call(nofun, 2)
 1110:     catch
 1111: 	error:function_clause:Stacktrace2 ->
 1112: 	    code:load_file(code_b_test),
 1113: 	    case Stacktrace2 of
 1114: 		      [{code_b_test,call,[nofun,2],_},
 1115: 		       {?MODULE,purge_stacktrace_test,1,_}|_] ->
 1116: 			  false = code:purge(code_b_test)
 1117: 		  end
 1118:     end,
 1119:     Args = [erlang,error,[badarg]],
 1120:     try code_b_test:call(erlang, error, [badarg,Args])
 1121:     catch
 1122: 	error:badarg:Stacktrace3 ->
 1123: 	    code:load_file(code_b_test),
 1124: 	    case Stacktrace3 of
 1125: 		      [{code_b_test,call,Args,_},
 1126: 		       {?MODULE,purge_stacktrace_test,1,_}|_] ->
 1127: 			  false = code:purge(code_b_test)
 1128: 		  end
 1129:     end,
 1130:     ok.
 1131: 
 1132: mult_lib_roots(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1133:     DataDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mult_lib_roots"),
 1134:     mult_lib_compile(DataDir, "my_dummy_app-b/ebin/lists"),
 1135: 
 1136:     %% We will use this module to test both code path loading and
 1137:     %% code path caching. So we ensure its beam file does not exist.
 1138:     CodeSuiteMultRootBeam =
 1139: 	filename:join(DataDir, "first_root/my_dummy_app-c/ebin/code_SUITE_mult_root_module.beam"),
 1140:     file:delete(CodeSuiteMultRootBeam),
 1141: 
 1142:     %% Set up ERL_LIBS and start a peer node.
 1143:     ErlLibs = filename:join(DataDir, "first_root") ++ mult_lib_sep() ++
 1144: 	filename:join(DataDir, "second_root"),
 1145: 
 1146:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-env", "ERL_LIBS", ErlLibs]),
 1147: 
 1148:     Path0 = rpc:call(Node, code, get_path, []),
 1149:     %% ?CT_PEER adds extra path to this module folder
 1150:     PathToSelf = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1151:     [PathToSelf, "."|Path1] = Path0,
 1152:     [Kernel|Path2] = Path1,
 1153:     [Stdlib|Path3] = Path2,
 1154:     mult_lib_verify_lib(Kernel, "kernel"),
 1155:     mult_lib_verify_lib(Stdlib, "stdlib"),
 1156:     [Lib1,Lib2,Lib3,Lib4,Lib5|Path] = Path3,
 1157: 
 1158: 
 1159:     ["first_root/my_dummy_app-a/ebin",
 1160:      "first_root/my_dummy_app-b/ebin",
 1161:      "first_root/my_dummy_app-c/ebin",
 1162:      "second_root/my_dummy_app-d/ebin",
 1163:      "second_root/my_dummy_app-e/ebin"] =
 1164: 	[mult_lib_remove_prefix(E, DataDir) ||
 1165: 	    E <- lists:sort([Lib1,Lib2,Lib3,Lib4,Lib5])],
 1166:     io:format("~p\n", [Path]),
 1167: 
 1168:     %% Now let's attempt to dynamically add a module,
 1169:     %% this will fail due to the boot paths cache.
 1170:     error = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1171:     mult_lib_compile(DataDir, "my_dummy_app-c/ebin/code_SUITE_mult_root_module"),
 1172:     error = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1173:     %% Test that the CWD is not cached
 1174:     File = filename:join([DataDir, "first_root/my_dummy_app-c/ebin/code_SUITE_mult_root_module"]),
 1175:     {ok, _} = compile:file(File, [{outdir, "."}]),
 1176:     {_,_,_} = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1177:     true = rpc:call(Node, code_SUITE_mult_root_module, works_fine, []),
 1178:     file:delete("code_SUITE_mult_root_module.beam"),
 1179:     %% Clean up so we can start again
 1180:     file:delete(CodeSuiteMultRootBeam),
 1181:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1182: 
 1183:     NoCacheArgs = ["-env", "ERL_LIBS", ErlLibs, "-cache_boot_paths", "false"],
 1184:     {ok, NoCachePeer, NoCacheNode} = ?CT_PEER(NoCacheArgs),
 1185: 
 1186:     %% Now the same code should work
 1187:     error = rpc:call(NoCacheNode, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1188:     mult_lib_compile(DataDir, "my_dummy_app-c/ebin/code_SUITE_mult_root_module"),
 1189:     {_,_,_} = rpc:call(NoCacheNode, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1190:     true = rpc:call(NoCacheNode, code_SUITE_mult_root_module, works_fine, []),
 1191: 
 1192:     peer:stop(NoCachePeer),
 1193:     ok.
 1194: 
 1195: mult_lib_compile(Root, Last) ->
 1196:     Mod = list_to_atom(filename:basename(Last)),
 1197:     Name = filename:join([Root,"first_root",Last]),
 1198:     Dir = filename:dirname(Name),
 1199:     {ok,Mod} = compile:file(Name, [report,{outdir,Dir}]),
 1200:     ok.
 1201: 
 1202: mult_lib_sep() ->
 1203:     case os:type() of
 1204: 	{win32,_} -> ";";
 1205: 	_ -> ":"
 1206:     end.
 1207: 
 1208: mult_lib_verify_lib(Path, Expected) ->
 1209:     Dir = filename:basename(filename:dirname(Path)),
 1210:     true = lists:prefix(Expected, Dir).
 1211: 
 1212: mult_lib_remove_prefix([H|T1], [H|T2]) ->
 1213:     mult_lib_remove_prefix(T1, T2);
 1214: mult_lib_remove_prefix([$/|T], []) -> T.
 1215: 
 1216: bad_erl_libs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1217:     %% Preserve ERL_LIBS if set.
 1218:     BadLibs0 = "/no/such/dir",
 1219:     BadLibs =
 1220:          case os:getenv("ERL_LIBS") of
 1221:              false -> BadLibs0;
 1222:              Libs -> BadLibs0 ++ ":" ++ Libs
 1223:          end,
 1224:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1225:     Code = rpc:call(Node,code,get_path,[]),
 1226:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1227: 
 1228:     {ok, Peer2, Node2} = ?CT_PEER(["-env", "ERL_LIBS", BadLibs]),
 1229:     Code2 = rpc:call(Node2,code,get_path,[]),
 1230:     peer:stop(Peer2),
 1231:     %% Test that code path is not affected by the faulty ERL_LIBS
 1232:     Code = Code2,
 1233: 
 1234:     ok.
 1235: 
 1236: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1237: 
 1238: %% Create an archive file containing an application and make use of it.
 1239: 
 1240: code_archive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1241:     do_code_archive(Config, "code_archive_libs", false).
 1242: 
 1243: code_archive2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1244:     do_code_archive(Config, "code_archive_libs2", true).
 1245: 
 1246: do_code_archive(Config, Root, StripVsn) when is_list(Config) ->
 1247:     %% Copy the orig files to priv_dir
 1248:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1249:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1250:     App = code_archive_dict,
 1251:     VsnBase = atom_to_list(App) ++ "-1.0",
 1252:     Base =
 1253: 	case StripVsn of
 1254: 	    true  -> atom_to_list(App);
 1255: 	    false -> VsnBase
 1256: 	end,
 1257:     Ext = init:archive_extension(),
 1258:     RootDir = filename:join([PrivDir, Root]),
 1259:     ok = file:make_dir(RootDir),
 1260:     Archive = filename:join([RootDir, VsnBase ++ Ext]),
 1261:     {ok, _} = zip:create(Archive, [VsnBase],
 1262: 			       [{compress, []}, {cwd, DataDir}]),
 1263:     {ok, _} = zip:extract(Archive, [{cwd, PrivDir}]),
 1264: 
 1265:     case StripVsn of
 1266: 	true ->
 1267: 	    ok = file:rename(filename:join([PrivDir, VsnBase]),
 1268: 				   filename:join([PrivDir, Base]));
 1269: 	false ->
 1270: 	    ok
 1271:     end,
 1272: 
 1273:     io:format("DEBUG: ~p\n", [?LINE]),
 1274:     %% Compile the code
 1275:     ok = compile_app(PrivDir, Base),
 1276: 
 1277:     %% Create the archive
 1278:     ok = file:delete(Archive),
 1279:     {ok, _} = zip:create(Archive, [Base],
 1280: 			       [{compress, []}, {cwd, PrivDir}]),
 1281: 
 1282:     %% Create a directory and a file outside of the archive.
 1283:     OtherFile = filename:join([RootDir,VsnBase,"other","other.txt"]),
 1284:     OtherContents = ?MODULE:module_info(md5),
 1285:     filelib:ensure_dir(OtherFile),
 1286:     ok = file:write_file(OtherFile, OtherContents),
 1287: 
 1288:     %% Set up ERL_LIBS and start a peer node.
 1289:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-env", "ERL_LIBS", RootDir]),
 1290:     CodePath = rpc:call(Node, code, get_path, []),
 1291:     AppEbin = filename:join([Archive, Base, "ebin"]),
 1292:     io:format("AppEbin: ~p\n", [AppEbin]),
 1293:     io:format("CodePath: ~p\n", [CodePath]),
 1294:     io:format("Archive: ~p\n", [erl_prim_loader:read_file_info(Archive)]),
 1295:     true = lists:member(AppEbin, CodePath),
 1296: 
 1297:     %% Start the app
 1298:     ok = rpc:call(Node, application, start, [App]),
 1299: 
 1300:     %% Get the lib dir for the app.
 1301:     AppLibDir = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [App]),
 1302:     io:format("AppLibDir: ~p\n", [AppLibDir]),
 1303:     AppLibDir = filename:join(RootDir, VsnBase),
 1304: 
 1305:     %% Access the app priv dir
 1306:     AppPrivDir = rpc:call(Node, code, priv_dir, [App]),
 1307:     AppPrivFile = filename:join([AppPrivDir, "code_archive.txt"]),
 1308:     io:format("AppPrivFile: ~p\n", [AppPrivFile]),
 1309:     {ok, _Bin, _} =
 1310: 	rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, get_file, [AppPrivFile]),
 1311: 
 1312:     %% Read back the other text file.
 1313:     OtherDirPath = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [App,other]),
 1314:     OtherFilePath = filename:join(OtherDirPath, "other.txt"),
 1315:     io:format("OtherFilePath: ~p\n", [OtherFilePath]),
 1316:     {ok, OtherContents, _} =
 1317: 	rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, get_file, [OtherFilePath]),
 1318: 
 1319:     %% Use the app
 1320:     Tab = code_archive_tab,
 1321:     Key = foo,
 1322:     Val = bar,
 1323:     {ok, _Pid} =  rpc:call(Node, App, new, [Tab]),
 1324:     error =  rpc:call(Node, App, find, [Tab, Key]),
 1325:     ok =  rpc:call(Node, App, store, [Tab, Key, Val]),
 1326:     {ok, Val} =  rpc:call(Node, App, find, [Tab, Key]),
 1327:     ok =  rpc:call(Node, App, erase, [Tab, Key]),
 1328:     error =  rpc:call(Node, App, find, [Tab, Key]),
 1329:     ok =  rpc:call(Node, App, erase, [Tab]),
 1330: 
 1331:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1332:     ok.
 1333: 
 1334: compile_app(TopDir, AppName) ->
 1335:     AppDir = filename:join([TopDir, AppName]),
 1336:     SrcDir = filename:join([AppDir, "src"]),
 1337:     OutDir = filename:join([AppDir, "ebin"]),
 1338:     {ok, Files} = file:list_dir(SrcDir),
 1339:     compile_files(Files, SrcDir, OutDir).
 1340: 
 1341: compile_files([File | Files], SrcDir, OutDir) ->
 1342:     case filename:extension(File) of
 1343: 	".erl" ->
 1344: 	    AbsFile = filename:join([SrcDir, File]),
 1345: 	    case compile:file(AbsFile, [{outdir, OutDir}]) of
 1346: 		{ok, _Mod} ->
 1347: 		    compile_files(Files, SrcDir, OutDir);
 1348: 		Error ->
 1349: 		    {compilation_error, AbsFile, OutDir, Error}
 1350: 	    end;
 1351: 	_ ->
 1352: 	    compile_files(Files, SrcDir, OutDir)
 1353:     end;
 1354: compile_files([], _, _) ->
 1355:     ok.
 1356: 
 1357: %% Test that a boot file with (almost) all of OTP can be used to start an
 1358: %% embeddedd system.
 1359: big_boot_embedded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1360:     {BootArg,AppsInBoot} = create_big_boot(Config),
 1361:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-boot", BootArg, "-mode", "embedded"]),
 1362:     RemoteNodeApps =
 1363: 	[ {X,Y} || {X,_,Y} <-
 1364: 		       rpc:call(Node,application,loaded_applications,[]) ],
 1365:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1366:     true = lists:sort(AppsInBoot) =:=  lists:sort(RemoteNodeApps),
 1367:     ok.
 1368: 
 1369: on_load(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1370:     Master = on_load_test_case_process,
 1371: 
 1372:     Data = filename:join([proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),"on_load"]),
 1373:     ok = file:set_cwd(Data),
 1374:     up_to_date = make:all([{d,'MASTER',Master}]),
 1375: 
 1376:     %% Register a name for this process.
 1377:     register(Master, self()),
 1378: 
 1379:     {_,Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1380: 					  exit(on_load_a:data())
 1381: 				  end),
 1382:     receive
 1383: 	{on_load_a,start} -> ok
 1384:     end,
 1385:     receive
 1386: 	{on_load_b,start} -> ok
 1387:     end,
 1388:     receive
 1389: 	{on_load_c,PidC} -> ok
 1390:     end,
 1391: 
 1392:     Refs = on_load_massive_spawn(lists:seq(1, 50)),
 1393:     receive after 7 -> ok end,
 1394: 
 1395:     PidC ! go,
 1396: 
 1397:     KernelLibDir = code:lib_dir(kernel),
 1398:     receive
 1399: 	{on_load_c,done} -> ok
 1400:     end,
 1401:     receive
 1402: 	{on_load_b,done} -> ok
 1403:     end,
 1404:     receive
 1405: 	{on_load_a,KernelLibDir} -> ok
 1406:     end,
 1407: 
 1408:     receive
 1409: 	{'DOWN',Ref,process,_,Res} ->
 1410: 	    [a,b,c] = Res
 1411:     end,
 1412: 
 1413:     on_load_wait_for_all(Refs),
 1414:     receive
 1415: 	Any ->
 1416: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Any})
 1417:     after 10 ->
 1418: 	    ok
 1419:     end.
 1420: 
 1421: on_load_massive_spawn([_|T]) ->
 1422:     {_,Ra} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> [a,b,c] = on_load_a:data() end),
 1423:     {_,Rb} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> [b,c] = on_load_b:data() end),
 1424:     {_,Rc} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> [c] = on_load_c:data() end),
 1425:     [Ra,Rb,Rc|on_load_massive_spawn(T)];
 1426: on_load_massive_spawn([]) -> [].
 1427: 
 1428: on_load_wait_for_all([Ref|T]) ->
 1429:     receive
 1430: 	{'DOWN',Ref,process,_,normal} ->
 1431: 	    on_load_wait_for_all(T)
 1432:     end;
 1433: on_load_wait_for_all([]) -> ok.
 1434: 
 1435: on_load_binary(_) ->
 1436:     Master = on_load_binary_test_case_process,
 1437:     register(Master, self()),
 1438: 
 1439:     %% Construct, compile and pretty-print.
 1440:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1441:     File = atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl",
 1442:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1443: 	       "-export([ok/0]).\n",
 1444: 	       "-on_load({init,0}).\n",
 1445: 	       "init() ->\n",
 1446: 	       "  '@Master@' ! {on_load_binary,self()},\n",
 1447: 	       "  receive go -> ok end.\n",
 1448: 	       "ok() -> true.\n"]),
 1449:     {ok,Mod,Bin} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1450:     merl:print(Tree),
 1451: 
 1452:     {Pid1,Ref1} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1453: 					code:load_binary(Mod, File, Bin),
 1454: 					true = Mod:ok()
 1455: 				end),
 1456:     receive {Mod,OnLoadPid} -> ok end,
 1457:     {Pid2,Ref2} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1458: 					true = Mod:ok()
 1459: 				end),
 1460:     erlang:yield(),
 1461:     OnLoadPid ! go,
 1462:     receive {'DOWN',Ref1,process,Pid1,Exit1} -> ok end,
 1463:     receive {'DOWN',Ref2,process,Pid2,Exit2} -> ok end,
 1464:     normal = Exit1,
 1465:     normal = Exit2,
 1466:     true = code:delete(Mod),
 1467:     false = code:purge(Mod),
 1468:     ok.
 1469: 
 1470: on_load_binary_twice(_) ->
 1471:     Master = on_load_binary_twice_test_case_process,
 1472:     register(Master, self()),
 1473: 
 1474:     %% Construct, compile and pretty-print.
 1475:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1476:     File = atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl",
 1477:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1478:            "-export([ok/0]).\n",
 1479:            "-on_load({init,0}).\n",
 1480:            "init() ->\n",
 1481:            "  '@Master@' ! {on_load_binary_twice,self()},\n",
 1482:            "  receive go -> ok end.\n",
 1483:            "ok() -> true.\n"]),
 1484:     {ok,Mod,Bin} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1485:     merl:print(Tree),
 1486: 
 1487:     {Pid1,Ref1} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1488:                     code:load_binary(Mod, File, Bin),
 1489:                     true = Mod:ok()
 1490:                 end),
 1491:     receive {Mod,OnLoadPid1} -> ok end,
 1492:     {Pid2,Ref2} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1493:                     code:load_binary(Mod, File, Bin),
 1494:                     true = Mod:ok()
 1495:                 end),
 1496:     erlang:yield(),
 1497: 
 1498:     OnLoadPid1 ! go,
 1499:     receive {'DOWN',Ref1,process,Pid1,Exit1} -> ok end,
 1500:     normal = Exit1,
 1501: 
 1502:     receive {Mod,OnLoadPid2} -> ok end,
 1503:     OnLoadPid2 ! go,
 1504:     receive {'DOWN',Ref2,process,Pid2,Exit2} -> ok end,
 1505:     normal = Exit2,
 1506: 
 1507:     false = code:purge(Mod),
 1508:     true = code:delete(Mod),
 1509:     ok.
 1510: 
 1511: on_load_embedded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1512:     try
 1513: 	on_load_embedded_1(Config)
 1514:     catch
 1515: 	throw:{skip,_}=Skip ->
 1516: 	    Skip
 1517:     end.
 1518: 
 1519: on_load_embedded_1(Config) ->
 1520:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1521:     LinkName = proplists:get_value(link_name, Config),
 1522: 
 1523:     %% Link the on_load_app application into the lib directory.
 1524:     OnLoadApp = filename:join(DataDir, "on_load_app-1.0"),
 1525:     del_link(LinkName),
 1526:     io:format("LinkName :~p, OnLoadApp: ~p~n",[LinkName,OnLoadApp]),
 1527:     case file:make_symlink(OnLoadApp, LinkName) of
 1528: 	{error,enotsup} ->
 1529: 	    throw({skip,"Support for symlinks required"});
 1530: 	{error,eperm} ->
 1531: 	    %% On Windows, we may not have permissions to create symlinks.
 1532: 	    throw({skip,"Support for symlinks required"});
 1533: 	ok -> ok
 1534:     end,
 1535: 
 1536:     %% Compile the code.
 1537:     OnLoadAppEbin = filename:join(LinkName, "ebin"),
 1538:     {ok,_ } = compile:file(filename:join([OnLoadApp,"src",
 1539: 						"on_load_embedded"]),
 1540: 				 [{outdir,OnLoadAppEbin}]),
 1541: 
 1542:     %% Create and compile a boot file.
 1543:     true = code:add_pathz(OnLoadAppEbin),
 1544:     Options = case is_source_dir() of
 1545: 		  true -> [local];
 1546: 		  false -> []
 1547: 	      end,
 1548:     BootScript = create_boot(Config, Options),
 1549:     true = code:del_path(OnLoadAppEbin),
 1550: 
 1551:     %% Start the node and check that the on_load function was run.
 1552:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-mode", "embedded", "-boot", BootScript]),
 1553:     ok = rpc:call(Node, on_load_embedded, status, []),
 1554: 
 1555:     %% Clean up.
 1556:     peer:stop(Peer).
 1557: 
 1558: del_link(LinkName) ->
 1559:    case file:delete(LinkName) of
 1560:        {error,eperm} ->
 1561:              file:del_dir(LinkName);
 1562:        Other ->
 1563:        	     Other
 1564:    end.
 1565: 
 1566: create_boot(Config, Options) ->
 1567:     {ok, OldDir} = file:get_cwd(),
 1568:     {LatestDir,LatestName} = create_script(Config),
 1569:     ok = file:set_cwd(LatestDir),
 1570:     ok = systools:make_script(LatestName, Options),
 1571:     ok = file:set_cwd(OldDir),
 1572:     filename:join(LatestDir, LatestName).
 1573: 
 1574: create_script(Config) ->
 1575:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1576:     Name = PrivDir ++ "on_load_test",
 1577:     Apps = application_controller:which_applications(),
 1578:     {value,{_,_,KernelVer}} = lists:keysearch(kernel, 1, Apps),
 1579:     {value,{_,_,StdlibVer}} = lists:keysearch(stdlib, 1, Apps),
 1580:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(Name ++ ".rel", [write]),
 1581:     io:format(Fd,
 1582: 		    "{release, {\"Test release 3\", \"P2A\"}, \n"
 1583: 		    " {erts, \"9.42\"}, \n"
 1584: 		    " [{kernel, \"~s\"}, {stdlib, \"~s\"},"
 1585: 		    " {on_load_app, \"1.0\"}]}.\n",
 1586: 		    [KernelVer,StdlibVer]),
 1587:     file:close(Fd),
 1588:     {filename:dirname(Name),filename:basename(Name)}.
 1589: 
 1590: create_big_boot(Config) ->
 1591:     {ok, OldDir} = file:get_cwd(),
 1592:     {Options,Local} = case is_source_dir() of
 1593: 				true -> {[no_module_tests,local],true};
 1594: 				_ -> {[no_module_tests],false}
 1595: 			    end,
 1596:     {LatestDir,LatestName,Apps} = create_big_script(Config,Local),
 1597:     ok = file:set_cwd(LatestDir),
 1598:     ok = systools:make_script(LatestName, Options),
 1599:     ok = file:set_cwd(OldDir),
 1600:     {filename:join(LatestDir, LatestName),Apps}.
 1601: 
 1602: %% The following apps cannot be loaded.
 1603: 
 1604: %% Orber requires explicit configuration
 1605: filter_app("orber",_) -> false;
 1606: 
 1607: %% cos* depends on orber
 1608: filter_app("cos"++_,_) -> false;
 1609: 
 1610: %% ic has a mod instruction in the app file but no corresponding start
 1611: %% function
 1612: filter_app("ic",_) -> false;
 1613: 
 1614: %% Netconf has some dependency that I really do not understand (maybe
 1615: %% like orber)
 1616: filter_app("netconf",_) -> false;
 1617: 
 1618: %% Safe has the same kind of error in the .app file as ic
 1619: filter_app("safe",_) -> false;
 1620: 
 1621: %% Comte cannot be started in the "usual" way
 1622: filter_app("comte",_) -> false;
 1623: 
 1624: %% OS_mon does not find its port program when running cerl
 1625: filter_app("os_mon",true) -> false;
 1626: 
 1627: %% erts is not a "real" app either =/
 1628: filter_app("erts",_) -> false;
 1629: 
 1630: %% wx* depends on that wxwidgets libs
 1631: filter_app("wx"++_,_) -> false;
 1632: 
 1633: %% Other apps should be OK.
 1634: filter_app(_,_) -> true.
 1635: 
 1636: create_big_script(Config,Local) ->
 1637:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1638:     Name = filename:join(PrivDir,"full_script_test"),
 1639:     InitialApplications=application:loaded_applications(),
 1640:     %% Applications left loaded by the application suite, unload them!
 1641:     UnloadFix=[app0,app1,app2,group_leader,app_start_error],
 1642:     [application:unload(Leftover) ||
 1643: 	      Leftover <- UnloadFix,
 1644: 	      lists:keymember(Leftover,1,InitialApplications) ],
 1645:     %% Now we should have only "real" applications...
 1646:     [application:load(list_to_atom(Y))
 1647: 	|| {match,[Y]} <- [re:run(X,code:lib_dir()++"/"++"([^/-]*).*/ebin",
 1648: 		[{capture,[1],list},unicode]) ||
 1649: 	    X <- code:get_path()],filter_app(Y,Local)],
 1650:     Apps = [ {N,V} || {N,_,V} <- application:loaded_applications()],
 1651:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(Name ++ ".rel", [write]),
 1652:     io:format(Fd,
 1653: 		    "{release, {\"Test release 3\", \"P2A\"}, \n"
 1654: 		    " {erts, \"9.42\"}, \n"
 1655: 		    " ~p}.\n",
 1656: 		    [Apps]),
 1657:     file:close(Fd),
 1658:     NewlyLoaded =
 1659: 	application:loaded_applications() -- InitialApplications,
 1660:     [ application:unload(N) || {N,_,_} <- NewlyLoaded],
 1661:     {filename:dirname(Name),filename:basename(Name),Apps}.
 1662: 
 1663: is_source_dir() ->
 1664:     filename:basename(code:lib_dir(kernel)) =:= "kernel" andalso
 1665: 	filename:basename(code:lib_dir(stdlib)) =:= "stdlib".
 1666: 
 1667: on_load_errors(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1668:     Master = on_load_error_test_case_process,
 1669:     register(Master, self()),
 1670: 
 1671:     Data = filename:join([proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),"on_load_errors"]),
 1672:     ok = file:set_cwd(Data),
 1673:     up_to_date = make:all([{d,'MASTER',Master}]),
 1674: 
 1675:     do_on_load_error(an_atom),
 1676: 
 1677:     error_logger:add_report_handler(?MODULE, self()),
 1678: 
 1679:     do_on_load_error({something,terrible,is,wrong}),
 1680:     receive
 1681: 	Any1 ->
 1682: 	    {_, "The on_load function"++_,
 1683: 		   [on_load_error,
 1684: 		    {something,terrible,is,wrong},_]} = Any1
 1685:     end,
 1686: 
 1687:     do_on_load_error(fail),		%Cause exception.
 1688:     receive
 1689: 	Any2 ->
 1690: 	    {_, "The on_load function"++_,
 1691: 		   [on_load_error,{failed,[_|_]},_]} = Any2
 1692:     end,
 1693: 
 1694:     %% There should be no more messages.
 1695:     receive
 1696: 	Unexpected ->
 1697: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Unexpected})
 1698:     after 10 ->
 1699: 	    ok
 1700:     end,
 1701: 
 1702:     %% Make sure that the code loading functions return the correct
 1703:     %% error code.
 1704:     Simple = simple_on_load_error,
 1705:     SimpleList = atom_to_list(Simple),
 1706:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_file(Simple),
 1707:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:ensure_loaded(Simple),
 1708:     {ok,SimpleCode} = file:read_file("simple_on_load_error.beam"),
 1709:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_binary(Simple, "", SimpleCode),
 1710:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_abs(SimpleList),
 1711:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_abs(SimpleList, Simple),
 1712: 
 1713:     ok.
 1714: 
 1715: do_on_load_error(ReturnValue) ->
 1716:     {_,Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1717: 					  exit(on_load_error:main())
 1718: 				  end),
 1719:     receive {on_load_error,ErrorPid} -> ok end,
 1720:     ErrorPid ! ReturnValue,
 1721:     receive
 1722: 	{'DOWN',Ref,process,_,Exit} ->
 1723: 	    {undef,[{on_load_error,main,[],_}|_]} = Exit
 1724:     end.
 1725: 
 1726: on_load_update(Config) ->
 1727:     {Mod,Code1} = on_load_update_code(1),
 1728:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code1),
 1729:     42 = Mod:a(),
 1730:     100 = Mod:b(99),
 1731:     4 = erlang:trace_pattern({Mod,'_','_'}, true),
 1732: 
 1733:     {Mod,Code2} = on_load_update_code(2),
 1734:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code2),
 1735:     42 = Mod:a(),
 1736:     78 = Mod:b(77),
 1737:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Mod:never()),
 1738:     4 = erlang:trace_pattern({Mod,'_','_'}, false),
 1739: 
 1740:     {Mod,Code3} = on_load_update_code(3),
 1741:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code3),
 1742:     100 = Mod:c(),
 1743:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Mod:a()),
 1744:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Mod:b(10)),
 1745:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Mod:never()),
 1746: 
 1747:     code:purge(Mod),
 1748:     code:delete(Mod),
 1749:     code:purge(Mod),
 1750:     ok.
 1751: 
 1752: on_load_update_code(Version) ->
 1753:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1754:     Tree = on_load_update_code_1(Version, Mod),
 1755:     io:format("Version ~p", [Version]),
 1756:     {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1757:     merl:print(Tree),
 1758:     io:nl(),
 1759:     {Mod,Code}.
 1760: 
 1761: on_load_update_code_1(1, Mod) ->
 1762:     ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1763: 	"-export([a/0,b/1]).\n"
 1764: 	"-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1765: 	"f() -> ok.\n",
 1766: 	"a() -> 42.\n"
 1767: 	"b(I) -> I+1.\n"]);
 1768: on_load_update_code_1(2, Mod) ->
 1769:     ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1770: 	"-export([never/0]).\n"
 1771: 	"-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1772: 	"f() -> 42 = '@Mod@':a(), 1 = '@Mod@':b(0), fail.\n",
 1773: 	"never() -> never.\n"]);
 1774: on_load_update_code_1(3, Mod) ->
 1775:     ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1776: 	"-export([c/0]).\n"
 1777: 	"-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1778: 	"f() -> ok.\n",
 1779: 	"c() -> 100.\n"]).
 1780: 
 1781: %% Test -on_load while trace feature 'on_load' is enabled (OTP-14612)
 1782: on_load_trace_on_load(Config) ->
 1783:     %% 'on_load' enables tracing for all newly loaded modules, so we make a dry
 1784:     %% run to ensure that ancillary modules like 'merl' won't be loaded during
 1785:     %% the actual test.
 1786:     on_load_update(Config),
 1787: 
 1788:     Papa = self(),
 1789:     Tracer = spawn_link(fun F() -> receive M -> Papa ! M end, F() end),
 1790:     {tracer,[]} = erlang:trace_info(self(),tracer),
 1791:     erlang:trace(self(), true, [call, {tracer, Tracer}]),
 1792:     erlang:trace_pattern(on_load, true, []),
 1793:     on_load_update(Config),
 1794:     erlang:trace_pattern(on_load, false, []),
 1795:     erlang:trace(self(), false, [call]),
 1796: 
 1797:     Ms = flush(),
 1798:     [{trace, Papa, call, {on_load_update_code, a, []}},
 1799:      {trace, Papa, call, {on_load_update_code, b, [99]}},
 1800:      {trace, Papa, call, {on_load_update_code, c, []}}] = Ms,
 1801: 
 1802:     exit(Tracer, normal),
 1803:     ok.
 1804: 
 1805: flush() ->
 1806:     receive M -> [M | flush()]
 1807:     after 100 -> []
 1808:     end.
 1809: 
 1810: on_load_purge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1811:     run_purge_test(fun on_load_purge_test/1, Config).
 1812: 
 1813: on_load_purge_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1814:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1815:     register(Mod, self()),
 1816:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1817: 	       "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1818: 	       "loop() -> loop().\n",
 1819: 	       "f() ->\n",
 1820: 	       "'@Mod@' ! {self(),spawn(fun loop/0)},\n",
 1821: 	       "receive Ack -> Ack end.\n"]),
 1822:     merl:print(Tree),
 1823:     {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1824:     P = spawn(fun() ->
 1825: 		      exit(code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code))
 1826: 	      end),
 1827:     monitor(process, P),
 1828:     receive
 1829: 	{Pid1,Pid2} ->
 1830: 	    monitor(process, Pid2),
 1831: 	    Pid1 ! ack_and_failure,
 1832: 	    receive
 1833: 		{'DOWN',_,process,P,Exit1} ->
 1834: 		    {error,on_load_failure} = Exit1
 1835: 	    end,
 1836: 	    receive
 1837: 		{'DOWN',_,process,Pid2,Exit2} ->
 1838: 		    io:format("~p\n", [Exit2])
 1839: 	    after 10000 ->
 1840: 		    ct:fail(no_down_message)
 1841: 	    end
 1842:     end,
 1843:     unregister(Mod),
 1844:     ok.
 1845: 
 1846: on_load_self_call(_Config) ->
 1847:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1848:     register(Mod, self()),
 1849:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1850: 	       "-export([ext/0]).\n",
 1851: 	       "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1852: 	       "f() ->\n",
 1853: 	       "  '@Mod@' ! (catch '@Mod@':ext()),\n",
 1854: 	       "  ok.\n",
 1855: 	       "ext() -> good_work.\n"]),
 1856:         merl:print(Tree),
 1857:     {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1858: 
 1859:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = on_load_do_load(Mod, Code),
 1860:     good_work = on_load_do_load(Mod, Code),
 1861: 
 1862:     ok.
 1863: 
 1864: on_load_do_load(Mod, Code) ->
 1865:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1866:                        {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code)
 1867:                end),
 1868:     receive
 1869: 	Any -> Any
 1870:     end.
 1871: 
 1872: on_load_pending(_Config) ->
 1873:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1874:     Tree1 = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1875: 		"-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1876: 		"f() ->\n",
 1877: 		"  register('@Mod@', self()),\n",
 1878: 		"  receive _ -> ok end.\n"]),
 1879:     merl:print(Tree1),
 1880:     {ok,Mod,Code1} = merl:compile(Tree1),
 1881: 
 1882:     Tree2 = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1883: 		"-export([t/0]).\n",
 1884: 		"t() -> ok.\n"]),
 1885:     merl:print(Tree2),
 1886:     {ok,Mod,Code2} = merl:compile(Tree2),
 1887: 
 1888:     Self = self(),
 1889:     {_,Ref1} =
 1890: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1891: 			      Self ! started1,
 1892: 			      {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code1)
 1893: 		      end),
 1894:     receive started1 -> ok end,
 1895:     timer:sleep(10),
 1896:     {_,Ref2} =
 1897: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1898: 			      Self ! started2,
 1899: 			      {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code2),
 1900: 			      ok = Mod:t()
 1901: 		      end),
 1902:     receive started2 -> ok end,
 1903:     receive
 1904: 	Unexpected ->
 1905: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Unexpected})
 1906:     after 100 ->
 1907: 	    ok
 1908:     end,
 1909:     Mod ! go,
 1910:     receive
 1911: 	{'DOWN',Ref1,process,_,normal} -> ok
 1912:     end,
 1913:     receive
 1914: 	{'DOWN',Ref2,process,_,normal} -> ok
 1915:     end,
 1916:     ok = Mod:t(),
 1917:     ok.
 1918: 
 1919: on_load_deleted(_Config) ->
 1920:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1921: 
 1922:     R0 = fun() ->
 1923: 		 Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1924: 			    "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1925: 			    "f() -> ok.\n"]),
 1926: 		 merl:print(Tree),
 1927: 		 {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1928: 		 {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code)
 1929: 	 end,
 1930:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R0),
 1931:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R0),
 1932: 
 1933:     R1 = fun() ->
 1934: 		 Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1935: 			    "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1936: 			    "f() -> fail.\n"]),
 1937: 		 merl:print(Tree),
 1938: 		 {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1939: 		 {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code)
 1940: 	 end,
 1941:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R1),
 1942:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R1),
 1943: 
 1944:     OtherMod = list_to_atom(lists:concat([Mod,"_42"])),
 1945:     OtherTree = ?Q(["-module('@OtherMod@').\n"]),
 1946:     merl:print(OtherTree),
 1947:     {ok,OtherMod,OtherCode} = merl:compile(OtherTree),
 1948: 
 1949:     R2 = fun() ->
 1950: 		 RegName = 'on_load__registered_name',
 1951: 		 Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1952: 			    "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1953: 			    "f() ->\n",
 1954: 			    "  register('@RegName@', self()),\n",
 1955: 			    "  receive _ -> ok end.\n"]),
 1956: 		 merl:print(Tree),
 1957: 		 {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1958: 		 spawn_link(fun() ->
 1959:                                     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code)
 1960:                             end),
 1961: 		 receive after 1 -> ok end,
 1962: 		 {module,OtherMod} = code:load_binary(OtherMod, "",
 1963: 						      OtherCode),
 1964: 		 RegName ! stop
 1965: 	 end,
 1966:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R2),
 1967: 
 1968:     ok.
 1969: 
 1970: on_load_deadlock(Config) ->
 1971:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1972:     register(Mod, self()),
 1973:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1974:                "-export([ext/0]).\n",
 1975:                "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1976:                "f() ->\n",
 1977:                "  timer:sleep(1000),\n",
 1978:                "  '@Mod@':ext().\n",
 1979:                "ext() -> ok.\n"]),
 1980:     merl:print(Tree),
 1981:     {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1982: 
 1983:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1984:     File = filename:join(Dir, atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".beam"),
 1985:     ok = file:write_file(File, Code),
 1986:     code:add_path(Dir),
 1987: 
 1988:     spawn(fun() -> code:ensure_loaded(Mod) end),
 1989:     {error,Reason} = code:ensure_loaded(Mod),
 1990:     true = (Reason =:= deadlock) or (Reason =:= on_load_failure),
 1991: 
 1992:     code:del_path(Dir),
 1993:     ok.
 1994: 
 1995: on_load_deadlock_load_binary_GH7466(Config) ->
 1996:     Tree = ?Q(["-module(foo).\n",
 1997:                "-on_load(init_module/0).\n",
 1998:                "-export([bar/0]).\n",
 1999:                "bar() -> ok.\n",
 2000:                "init_module() ->\n",
 2001:                "    timer:sleep(1000).\n"]),
 2002:     merl:print(Tree),
 2003: 
 2004:     %% Compiles the form, does not load binary
 2005:     {ok,Mod,Bin} = compile:forms(Tree),
 2006:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2007:     File = filename:join(Dir, "foo.beam"),
 2008:     ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
 2009:     code:add_path(Dir),
 2010: 
 2011:     Self = self(),
 2012:     LoadBin = fun() ->
 2013:                       _ = code:load_binary(Mod, "foo.beam", Bin),
 2014:                       Self ! {done, self()},
 2015:                       Self
 2016:               end,
 2017:     %% this deadlocks in OTP-26
 2018:     PidX = spawn(LoadBin),
 2019:     PidY = spawn(LoadBin),
 2020:     Self = LoadBin(),
 2021:     ok = receiver(PidX),
 2022:     ok = receiver(PidY),
 2023:     ok = receiver(Self),
 2024: 
 2025:     code:del_path(Dir),
 2026:     ok.
 2027: 
 2028: on_load_deadlock_ensure_loaded_GH7466(Config) ->
 2029:     Tree = ?Q(["-module(foo).\n",
 2030:                "-on_load(init_module/0).\n",
 2031:                "-export([bar/0]).\n",
 2032:                "bar() -> ok.\n",
 2033:                "init_module() ->\n",
 2034:                "    timer:sleep(1000), bar().\n"]),
 2035:     _ = merl:print(Tree),
 2036: 
 2037:     %% Compiles the form, does not load binary
 2038:     {ok,Mod,Bin} = compile:forms(Tree),
 2039:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2040:     File = filename:join(Dir, "foo.beam"),
 2041:     ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
 2042:     code:add_path(Dir),
 2043: 
 2044:     Self = self(),
 2045:     EnsureLoaded = fun() ->
 2046:                            _ = code:ensure_loaded(Mod),
 2047:                            Self ! {done, self()},
 2048:                            Self
 2049:                    end,
 2050:     Pid = spawn(EnsureLoaded),
 2051:     Pid2 = spawn(EnsureLoaded),
 2052:     Self = EnsureLoaded(),
 2053:     ok = receiver(Pid),
