 2054:     ok = receiver(Pid2),
 2055:     ok = receiver(Self),
 2056: 
 2057:     code:del_path(Dir),
 2058:     ok.
 2059: 
 2060: receiver(Pid) ->
 2061:     receive
 2062:         {done, Pid} -> ok
 2063:     after 10_000 ->
 2064:             it_deadlocked
 2065:     end.
 2066: 
 2067: delete_before_reload(Mod, Reload) ->
 2068:     false = check_old_code(Mod),
 2069: 
 2070:     Tree1 = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 2071: 		"-export([f/1]).\n",
 2072: 		"f(Parent) ->\n",
 2073: 		"  register('@Mod@', self()),\n",
 2074: 		"  Parent ! started,\n",
 2075: 		"  receive _ -> ok end.\n"]),
 2076:     merl:print(Tree1),
 2077:     {ok,Mod,Code1} = merl:compile(Tree1),
 2078: 
 2079:     Self = self(),
 2080:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 2081:                        {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code1),
 2082:                        Mod:f(Self)
 2083:                end),
 2084:     receive started -> ok end,
 2085: 
 2086:     true = code:delete(Mod),
 2087:     true = check_old_code(Mod),
 2088: 
 2089:     Reload(),
 2090: 
 2091:     %% When loading the the module with the -on_load() function,
 2092:     %% the reference to the old code would be lost. Make sure that
 2093:     %% the old code is remembered and is still preventing the
 2094:     %% purge.
 2095:     false = code:soft_purge(Mod),
 2096: 
 2097:     %% Get rid of the old code.
 2098:     Mod ! stop,
 2099:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
 2100:     true = code:soft_purge(Mod),
 2101: 
 2102:     %% Unload the version of the module with the -on_load() function.
 2103:     true = code:delete(Mod),
 2104:     true = code:soft_purge(Mod),
 2105: 
 2106:     ok.
 2107: 
 2108: %% Test that the mode of the code server is properly retrieved.
 2109: get_mode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2110:     interactive = code:get_mode().
 2111: 
 2112: %% Make sure that the paths for all loaded modules have been normalized.
 2113: normalized_paths(_Config) ->
 2114:     do_normalized_paths(erlang:loaded()).
 2115: 
 2116: do_normalized_paths([M|Ms]) ->
 2117:     case code:which(M) of
 2118: 	Special when is_atom(Special) ->
 2119: 	    do_normalized_paths(Ms);
 2120: 	File when is_list(File) ->
 2121: 	    File = filename:join([File]),
 2122: 	    do_normalized_paths(Ms)
 2123:     end;
 2124: do_normalized_paths([]) ->
 2125:     ok.
 2126: 
 2127: %% Make sure that the extra -mode flags are ignored
 2128: mult_embedded_flags(_Config) ->
 2129:     Modes = [{["-mode", "embedded"], embedded},
 2130: 	     {["-mode", "interactive"], interactive},
 2131: 	     {["-mode", "invalid"], interactive}],
 2132: 
 2133:     [ begin
 2134: 	  {ArgMode, ExpectedMode} = Mode,
 2135: 	  {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(ArgMode),
 2136: 	  ExpectedMode = rpc:call(Node, code, get_mode, []),
 2137: 	  peer:stop(Peer)
 2138:       end || Mode <- Modes],
 2139: 
 2140:     [ begin
 2141: 	  {ArgIgnoredMode, _} = IgnoredMode,
 2142: 	  {ArgRelevantMode, ExpectedMode} = RelevantMode,
 2143: 	  {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(ArgRelevantMode ++ ArgIgnoredMode),
 2144: 	  ExpectedMode = rpc:call(Node, code, get_mode, []),
 2145: 	  peer:stop(Peer)
 2146:       end || IgnoredMode <- Modes, RelevantMode <- Modes],
 2147:     ok.
 2148: 
 2149: %% Test that module_status/1 behaves as expected
 2150: module_status(_Config) ->
 2151:     case test_server:is_cover() of
 2152:         true ->
 2153:             module_status();
 2154:         false ->
 2155:             %% Make sure that we terminate the cover server.
 2156:             try
 2157:                 module_status()
 2158:             after
 2159:                 cover:stop()
 2160:             end
 2161:     end.
 2162: 
 2163: module_status() ->
 2164:     %% basics
 2165:     not_loaded = code:module_status(fubar),     % nonexisting
 2166:     {file, preloaded} = code:is_loaded(erlang),
 2167:     loaded = code:module_status(erlang),        % preloaded
 2168:     loaded = code:module_status(?MODULE),       % normal known loaded
 2169: 
 2170:     %% module_status/0 returns status for each loaded module
 2171:     true = (lists:sort([{M, code:module_status(M)}
 2172:                         || {M, _} <- code:all_loaded()])
 2173:             =:= lists:sort(code:module_status())),
 2174: 
 2175:     non_existing = code:which(?TESTMOD), % verify dummy name not in path
 2176:     code:purge(?TESTMOD), % ensure no previous version in memory
 2177:     code:delete(?TESTMOD),
 2178:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
 2179: 
 2180:     %% generated code is detected as such
 2181:     {ok,?TESTMOD,Bin} = compile:forms(dummy_ast(), []),
 2182:     {module,?TESTMOD} = code:load_binary(?TESTMOD,"",Bin),  % no source file
 2183:     ok = ?TESTMOD:f(),
 2184:     "" = code:which(?TESTMOD), % verify empty string for source file
 2185:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2186: 
 2187:     %% module_status/1 also accepts a list of modules
 2188:     [] = code:module_status([]),
 2189:     [{erlang, loaded},{?MODULE,loaded},{?TESTMOD,loaded}] =
 2190:         code:module_status([erlang, ?MODULE, ?TESTMOD]),
 2191: 
 2192:     %% deleting generated code
 2193:     true = code:delete(?TESTMOD),
 2194:     non_existing = code:which(?TESTMOD), % verify still not in path
 2195:     not_loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2196: 
 2197:     %% beam file exists but not loaded
 2198:     make_source_file(<<"0">>),
 2199:     compile_beam(0),
 2200:     true = (non_existing =/= code:which(?TESTMOD)), % verify in path
 2201:     not_loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2202: 
 2203:     %% loading code from disk makes it loaded
 2204:     load_code(),
 2205:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % loaded
 2206: 
 2207:     %% cover compiling a module
 2208:     {ok,?TESTMOD} = cover:compile(?TESTMOD),
 2209:     {file, cover_compiled} = code:is_loaded(?TESTMOD), % verify cover compiled
 2210:     modified = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % loaded cover code but file exists
 2211:     remove_code(),
 2212:     removed = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % removed
 2213:     compile_beam(0),
 2214:     modified = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % recreated
 2215:     load_code(),
 2216:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % loading removes cover status
 2217:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
 2218:     true = code:delete(?TESTMOD),
 2219:     not_loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % deleted
 2220: 
 2221:     %% recompilation ignores timestamps, only md5 matters
 2222:     load_code(),
 2223:     compile_beam(1100),
 2224:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2225: 
 2226:     %% modifying module detects different md5
 2227:     make_source_file(<<"1">>),
 2228:     compile_beam(0),
 2229:     modified = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2230: 
 2231:     %% loading the modified code from disk makes it loaded
 2232:     load_code(),
 2233:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2234: 
 2235:     %% removing and recreating a module with same md5
 2236:     remove_code(),
 2237:     removed = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2238:     compile_beam(0),
 2239:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2240: 
 2241:     ok.
 2242: 
 2243: compile_beam(Sleep) ->
 2244:     compile(Sleep, []).
 2245: 
 2246: compile(Sleep, Opts) ->
 2247:     timer:sleep(Sleep),  % increment compilation timestamp
 2248:     {ok,?TESTMOD} = compile:file(?TESTMODSRC, Opts).
 2249: 
 2250: load_code() ->
 2251:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
 2252:     {module,?TESTMOD} = code:load_file(?TESTMOD).
 2253: 
 2254: remove_code() ->
 2255:     ok = file:delete(?TESTMODOBJ).
 2256: 
 2257: make_source_file(Body) ->
 2258:     ok = file:write_file(?TESTMODSRC, dummy_source(Body)).
 2259: 
 2260: dummy_source(Body) ->
 2261:     [<<"-module(" ?TESTMODSTR ").\n"
 2262:        "-export([f/0]).\n"
 2263:        "f() -> ">>, Body, <<".\n">>].
 2264: 
 2265: dummy_ast() ->
 2266:     dummy_ast(?TESTMODSTR).
 2267: 
 2268: dummy_ast(Mod) when is_atom(Mod) ->
 2269:     dummy_ast(atom_to_list(Mod));
 2270: dummy_ast(ModStr) ->
 2271:     [scan_form("-module(" ++ ModStr ++ ")."),
 2272:      scan_form("-export([f/0])."),
 2273:      scan_form("f() -> ok.")].
 2274: 
 2275: scan_form(String) ->
 2276:     {ok,Ts,_} = erl_scan:string(String),
 2277:     {ok,F} = erl_parse:parse_form(Ts),
 2278:     F.
 2279: 
 2280: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2281: %% error_logger handler.
 2282: %% (Copied from stdlib/test/proc_lib_SUITE.erl.)
 2283: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2284: init(Tester) ->
 2285:     {ok, Tester}.
 2286: 
 2287: handle_event({warning_msg, _GL, Msg}, Tester) ->
 2288:     Tester ! Msg,
 2289:     {ok, Tester};
 2290: handle_event(_Event, State) ->
 2291:     {ok, State}.
 2292: 
 2293: handle_info(_, State) ->
 2294:     {ok, State}.
 2295: 
 2296: handle_call(_Query, State) -> {ok, {error, bad_query}, State}.
 2297: 
 2298: terminate(_Reason, State) ->
 2299:     State.
 2300: 
 2301: %%%
 2302: %%% Common utility functions.
 2303: %%%
 2304: 
 2305: run_purge_test(Test, Config) ->
 2306:     OSRL = erlang:system_info(outstanding_system_requests_limit),
 2307:     
 2308:     TestLowOSRL = case OSRL < 10 of
 2309:                       true -> 1;
 2310:                       false -> 5
 2311:                   end,
 2312: 
 2313:     io:format("Running with the default outstanding request limit of ~p~n", [OSRL]),
 2314:     Res1 = Test(Config),
 2315:     io:format("Result: ~p~n", [Res1]),
 2316:     try
 2317:         %% Run again with low limit and many processes...
 2318:         Procs = case erlang:system_info(process_limit) of
 2319:                     PLim when PLim < 20000 ->
 2320:                         erlang:system_info(process_limit) div 2;
 2321:                     _ ->
 2322:                         10000
 2323:                 end,
 2324:         erlang:system_flag(outstanding_system_requests_limit, TestLowOSRL),
 2325:         io:format("Running with outstanding request limit of ~p~n", [TestLowOSRL]),
 2326:         Ps = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 2327:                                spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end)
 2328:                        end, lists:seq(1, Procs)),
 2329:         Res2 = Test(Config),
 2330:         lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
 2331:                               unlink(P),
 2332:                               exit(P, kill)
 2333:                       end, Ps),
 2334:         lists:foreach(fun (P) -> is_process_alive(P) end, Ps),
 2335:         io:format("Result: ~p~n", [Res2]),
 2336:         {Res1, Res2}
 2337:     after
 2338:         TestLowOSRL = erlang:system_flag(outstanding_system_requests_limit, OSRL)
 2339:     end.
